column4: Hey all, I've just installed xubuntu 8.10 on an old laptop, and the GUI is... unuseful. Consoles work fine though.
Are you picking on my lack of capitalization, or did you miss that I did install Xubuntu, or are you suggesting another IRC channel?
Thanks. I think it's a driver/xorg issue because I can't even see the login prompt, so XFCE hasn't even started.
oh, then yeah, probably bad drivers
Oh! This is after I force the vesa driver. The standard driver just gives me a full-on white screen... like stress-the-LCD kind of white.
what video card does it have?
It's a ThinkPad 560E with a... Trident Cyber9660.
No, it's a Trident. There seem to be a lot of issues with many of those chips in Linux.
yeah, you may be in for a fight on that one
have you tried using kernel framebuffer?
So, I had read that vesa works, but no such luck for me. Haven't tried fb. Got a URL for that handy?
nope, but if you dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg it should ask if you want to use it or not
I think the  xorg.conf option is "UseFBDev"
Thanks. Trying. (And the Xorg log file is verbose. oeyh)
